availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Horatio Chandler (Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of John B. Chandler and Mary Ann Smith Chandler. Married to Candice “Cannie” Hord Chandler in Taylor County on April 15, 1862. Father of Bell F. Chandler. Student in Campbellsville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Merchant with his brother, William F. Chandler, in Campbellsville in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 2, p. 337A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, 1800-1954, Film #000983728, p. 170, p. 209 of 689 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film 7016131: All Counties, 1911, File #4942, p. 1576 of 3344 of microfilm.
